intro: Knautia arvensis var. integrifolia, commonly known as the smooth knautia, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of pink to purple flowers. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a soft, velvety texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. This plant is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting pollinators.
